name: places/ChIJN7ehcGhZwokRdqrmOlJ8Y7M
formattedAddress: 101 W 74th St #1B, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 101 W 74th St #1B, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text:
The only tailor you’ll ever need. His work is fantastic and he does a great job of balancing: your preferences, what’s trendy, and timeless “rules.” He’s not overbearing. He knows I like my pants a little shorter to show off ankles or socks vibe, for example.

Just this weekend at a party, the birthday girl commented “you always dress nice and your suits always look so well tailored.” That’s because they are well tailored.

I love that he makes my suit sleeve buttons functional. Such a power move to unbutton your suit jacket and roll up your sleeves, when 99% of off shelf suits out there come with non functioning sleeve buttons (I think they’re called surgeons buttons because surgeons has to role up their sleeves to work historically).

Anyway he measures and cuts flawlessly. He *can* get creative for weird issues and fixes you wouldn’t typically do, but he always goes over the pros and cons, how it will look, what he has to do to do it, and cost to help you decide. For example, one time I really wanted to save a suit where the pants drop was smaller than normal for this brand (Isaia) and we discussed using express fabric to create more room, or something like that, but after discussing thoroughly decided to just return the suit.

He’s not pushy at all even though he knows more about fit than most all of his customers. He advises, but never insists. But never be afraid to ask his opinion if you are not sure what to do! He is very “wise” and will definitely help you decide.

Anyway, can’t say enough good things. Please do yourself a favor and never wear a suit off the rack without tailoring it. It makes all the difference.

originalText.text: What was formerly “Anthony Tailor” is now newly remodeled “Kabbani”. Leo, the new owner and tailor, is so pleasant and does an AMAZING JOB at alterations. So far, he has altered two of Maje dresses I recently bought. One dress required hemming with a special border, so he made the border look identical to the original. The other dress had too long of a torso, but was a bit more complicated to fix BUT Leo was able to fix it in a way that didn’t seem like it was altered at all. Quick turn around and fair prices. Highly recommend for high end outfits. Welcome to the neighborhood Leo!

originalText.text: Kabbani did such an amazing job on tailoring my husbands suit for our wedding. We decided to elope last minute and Kabbani was able to fit us in on a tight timeline and the suit cane out gorgeously. Both the pants and jacket had some considerable adjustments to be made and it really came out perfectly. Thanks! We’ll definitely be coming back

originalText.text: Elsie was amazing and really helped me in a pinch. I was in and out with freshly hemmed and Ironed pants in under 30 minutes, with a minimal rush fee. THANK YOU

text.text: Elsie was amazing and really helped me in a pinch. I was in and out with freshly hemmed and Ironed pants in under 30 minutes, with a minimal rush fee. THANK YOU

originalText.text: I got quoted $25 to get dress pants hemmed with a smirk. It’s a 5 minute job and run-rates to $300 per hour. I find it amazing that they can charge like a small law firm.
